page.title: 02POPULATION
page.content: A survey of the population in the area indicated that a large percentage were born outside Nottinghamshire, over 33%. Indeed, more people were born outside the county than were born in the village itself. Within England the places of origin include significant numbers from the mainly mining areas of Derbyshire, South Yorkshire and Durham but also a sprinkling of people born as far afield as Northumberland and Devon. As well as England a small number were born in Scotland, Wales and N.I., there are also immigrants from Poland, Austria, Switzerland and West Germany. The numbers of each sex within our survey showed that there were more females than males in all age groups, indeed overall there are 20% more females than males. Within the age groups it was found that over 25% were under 17 and 5% were over 65.
